    @pytest.mark.bioburden_endotoxin_absent_zero_swab_rinse_split
    def test_bioburden_endotoxin_absent_zero_swab_rinse_split(self):
        vol_unit = self.policy_microbial.default_units.test_get_default_unit(data={"default_unit_name": "volume"})[
            "response"]
        surface_unit = \
            self.policy_microbial.default_units.test_get_default_unit(data={"default_unit_name": "surface_area"})[
                "response"]
        unit = json.loads(vol_unit)
        surface_unit = json.loads(surface_unit)
        policy = self.policy_microbial.test_get_microbial_cleaning_limits_policy()["response"]
        policy = json.loads(policy)["result"]
    
        volume_unit = unit["default_units"]["unit"]
        surface_area_unit = surface_unit["default_units"]["unit"]
    
        limit_data = {"default_endo": 0, "un_endo_value": 0, "un_bacterial_limit": 0, "un_fungal_limit": 0,
                      "default_bacterial_limit": 0, "default_fungal_limit": 0, "limit_type": "swab_rinse"}
    
        payload = create_cleaning_limit_policy_microbial(policy, {"splitBacteriaAndFungi": True,
                                                                  "default_unit": volume_unit,
                                                                  "surface_area_unit": surface_area_unit},
                                                         limit_data=limit_data)
    
        endotoxin_data = {}
        endotoxin_data.update({"update_policy_payload": payload})
